data.field: int - get the integer portion of a number

Returns the integer portion of EXPR. If EXPR is omitted, uses $_. You should not use this for rounding, because it truncates towards 0, and because machine representations of floating point numbers can sometimes produce counterintuitive results. Usually [perlfunc:sprintf|sprintf()] or [perlfunc:printf|printf()], or the POSIX::floor or POSIX::ceil functions, would serve you better.
